intro.description: This cheat sheet will help you deploy a Data Intensive Application in the test bed.

item.title: Set up
item.description: First, make sure your deployment service is properly set up, and that your workspace is configured to use a deployment container.

subitem.label: Install the DICE deployment service. Please follow the instructions at https://github.com/dice-project/DICE-Deployment-Service/wiki/Installation.
Create a container for your IDE. Please see instructions here: https://github.com/dice-project/DICE-Deployment-Service/wiki/Installation#container-management
In the Preferences, select Deployment Tools and fill in the configuration to your DICE deployment service instance.

item.title: Open a TOSCA blueprint
item.description:
Visit the page with the examples: https://github.com/dice-project/DICE-Deployment-Examples and download an example TOSCA blueprint (e.g., storm/storm-openstack.yaml if you are using OpenStack, or storm/storm-fco.yaml if your test bed is on the FCO).
Import the downloaded blueprint into your project.

subitem.label: From the menu Deployment Service select DICE Deployments Tool UI.
Log into the DICE deployment service using your username and password.

item.title: Deploy your blueprint
item.description: Follow these steps to deploy your blueprint.

subitem.label: In the DICE - Deployment Service panel, click on the Upload Blueprint.
In the file dialog, select your .yaml blueprint file and confirm the selection to close the dialog.
Click the Upload button that appears.
Wait for the deployment to finish. This may take several minutes or longer. If all goes well, the DICE - Deployment Service will show a "Blueprint successfully deployed" message.
